Abstract: This study explores the integration of machine learning, graphical processing units, and cloud computing to enable interactive quantum chemistry. By leveraging natural user interfaces and chemical structure recognition, users can interactively visualize and manipulate molecular structures, facilitating a deeper understanding of quantum chemical phenomena. The proposed system utilizes cloud computing to process complex quantum chemical calculations, while graphical processing units accelerate the rendering of 3D molecular models. Extended reality technologies are employed to create immersive, interactive environments, allowing users to explore and analyze quantum chemical data in a more engaging and accessible manner. The resulting system enables researchers to explore complex quantum chemical systems in a more intuitive and efficient way, driving innovation in the field of quantum chemistry.
